Recap: Rex confronts Charlie and Roxy about who his real father is. He tells Roxy she is no longer his mother and wants nothing to do with her anymore. John, Talia and Antonio listen in on Ramsey and his house guest. Just before he says who from Llanview is going to be most surprised the housekeeper interrupts and takes the tray. He leaves a photo of John where the woman can see it. Later we here Ramsey call the woman "Marty". Adriana goes to Marcie to apologize for how she's treated her in the past few months. She tells her she and Rex are separated. Shane asks if he can have his father's name. He invites Brody to the father son day at the community center. Gigi goes to Marcie's. When she sees Adriana she says she'll come back later. Adriana tells Gigi she didn't tell Rex about Shane and leaves for the airport.

Starr and Cole get into a heated discussion with a woman at the cafe about young people being parents when she sees them with Sam. Cole tells her all you need is love to be a good parent. The woman says she had kids but only after she went to college, traveled and was ready. Cole tells Starr not to listen to that woman but Starr agrees with her. Later in the park Cole suggests naming the baby Marty if its a girl. Starr doesn't seem thrilled but agrees. Sam starts crying but they can't calm him down. When Marcie walks by Starr asks her to help. The Ambassador of Mendoza welcomes the high princess. She takes off her sunglasses and says call me Tina. (Its Tina Lord!)
Transcript: Antonio: Ahem.
Talia: Hey.
John: Sorry.
[Talia giggles]
Talia: Stop.
Antonio: Well, this is it. This is the surveillance and the loaner from Cherryvale that Fish got for us.
John: It's nice.
Talia: They call it "big brother."
John: Yeah? I would say "sex, lies, and audiotape." Hopefully, you won't have to keep your relationship underground much longer. So, looks expensive. What's what?
Talia: Well, Antonio planted a recording device that's voice-activated, so when anybody comes upon vocal range, it'll just turn on, and we can hear.
Antonio: I wish I hadn't had to plant it on a serving tray, but it was the only way it was going to make it up the stairs. I just hope that Ramsey brings it near whoever he's got stashed up there.
Talia: Do we have any theories on who's up there?
Antonio: Just that it's a woman.
John: Yeah. The rest she's going to have to tell us herself.

Woman: No.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Waitress: So, that'll be three cheeseburgers, three orders of fries?
Cole: Yeah, and can you make that to go, please?
Waitress: Yeah. It'll be ready in just a minute.
Cole: Thank you.
Starr: Okay, thanks. We're going to go to the park, we're going to get you some popcorn, and you can go on the swings.
Woman: Is that your baby?
Cole: Oh, that's -- that's her little brother.
Woman: Oh. I should've known by what you were saying.

Rex: Hey, Mom. Hey, Dad. What's up? Well, not you, obviously. What a week. Boy, whoo! Hits just keep on coming. First I lost my father, then I lost my wife.

Marcie: I've been meaning to stop by since the wedding. It's just everything's been a little crazy after --
Adriana: The accident. Yeah, I know.
Marcie: Yeah.
Adriana: It must have been so scary for you and Michael, finding Sam in Todd's car.
Marcie: Yeah, it was, but he's okay, and Blair's got custody of him now.
Adriana: Blair and I, we have our issues, but she's going to take good care of him. I really believe that.
Marcie: Anyway, you must be here for this. You must be dying to get it. Here you go.
Adriana: Um, actually, I -- I didn't come for the guestbook. I -- I came to say "goodbye."

Cole: Yeah, well, that extra food was for me. I'm a big eater.

Cole: Well, excuse me --

Woman: My sister lives in Brooklyn, and she says the high school in her neighborhood has a daycare center. That's just like telling kids, "go ahead, screw around. Someone else will take care of the kid." And that pop star's little sister, like she's going to be responsible?
Cole: You know what? All you really need to raise a kid is love.

Starr: I think she's right.
